issue.title: feat: v0 Loader style migration from v9
issue.body: This Pull Request updates the v0 Loader to look like v9 Spinner. In v0 we import an SVG directly inside CSS as background-image. We replaced the old SVG with a new one looking like the v9 Spinner. The Loader gets the right stroke color based on the theme we are in. To do that we implemented a function that receives as parameters the desired values of the theme we are currently in and generates the desired SVG. We took the following design spec as a reference: ## Current Behavior | Teams | Teams Dark | Teams High Contrast| | ------------- | -------------| -------------| |||| ## New Behavior | Teams | Teams Dark | Teams High Contrast| | ------------- | -------------| -------------| ||| | ## Related Issue(s) Fixes #

issue.title: chore: Northstar screener should read from screenerStates.json
issue.body:
Screener is now separated into two workflows for secrets encapsulation, the code to trigger the screener run is actually run on the master branch.

## Current Behavior

The current northstar screener states are generated directly before running, this means that any changes to N* screener tests in a PR will never result in updated screenshots

## New Behavior

Update the `screener:build` gulp command to write all states to a json file and updeates the `screener:runner` gulp tasks to read states from the json file as a result of the build.

Since the entire `docs/dist` artifact is uploaded, there should be no changes needed for the pipeline


## Related Issue(s)

<!-- Please link the issue being fixed so it gets closed when this is merged. -->

Fixes #24842

issue.title: chore: Northstar screener should read from screenerStates.json
issue.body:
Screener is now separated into two workflows for secrets encapsulation, the code to trigger the screener run is actually run on the master branch.

## Current Behavior

The current northstar screener states are generated directly before running, this means that any changes to N* screener tests in a PR will never result in updated screenshots

## New Behavior

Update the `screener:build` gulp command to write all states to a json file and updeates the `screener:runner` gulp tasks to read states from the json file as a result of the build.

Since the entire `docs/dist` artifact is uploaded, there should be no changes needed for the pipeline

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for submitting a pull request!

Please verify that:
* [x] Code is up-to-date with the `master` branch
* [ ] Your changes are covered by tests (if possible)
* [ ] You've run `yarn change` locally

PR flow tips:
* [ ] Try to start with a Draft PR
* [ ] Once you're ready (ideally the pipeline is passing) promote your PR to Ready for Review. This step will auto-assign reviewers for your PR.
-->

**NOTE**: Recreating this PR because of a CI issue that may be caused by the original PR pointing to a remote repository. I'll close the other one if this works.

## Current Behavior

We currently have two different layouts for ChatMessage: comfy and compact.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6439050/179882363-027cbf0c-8573-444c-b366-839d737defe4.png)

## New Behavior

This introduces a new variation on the ChatMessage comfy layout. It is enabled by passing the `v2` property to `ChatMessage`. We have tried to use the existing ChatMessage interface as much as possible, but did have to add a few properties specific to the new layout to achieve the desired result. These properties are namespaced in such a way that it's clear that they only apply to when the v2 layout is enabled.

- **Existing usage of ChatMessage remains unchanged.**
- Metadata sits outside of the bubble (e.g. author, edited state).
- Timestamp shows on hover and focus states (still accessible via screen reader).
- Updated placement of badges (e.g. importance, at-mention).

![MicrosoftTeams-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6439050/179882699-f9d0076e-f62b-46e4-9200-fa376eb4e3db.png)

issue.title: chore: Northstar screener should read from screenerStates.json
issue.body:
Screener is now separated into two workflows for secrets encapsulation, the code to trigger the screener run is actually run on the master branch.

## Current Behavior

The current northstar screener states are generated directly before running, this means that any changes to N* screener tests in a PR will never result in updated screenshots

## New Behavior

Update the `screener:build` gulp command to write all states to a json file and updeates the `screener:runner` gulp tasks to read states from the json file as a result of the build.

Since the entire `docs/dist` artifact is uploaded, there should be no changes needed for the pipeline

issue.title: feat(ChatMessage): Add alternative 'v2' comfy layout
issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for submitting a pull request!

Please verify that:
* [x] Code is up-to-date with the `master` branch
* [ ] Your changes are covered by tests (if possible)
* [ ] You've run `yarn change` locally

PR flow tips:
* [ ] Try to start with a Draft PR
* [ ] Once you're ready (ideally the pipeline is passing) promote your PR to Ready for Review. This step will auto-assign reviewers for your PR.
-->

**NOTE**: Recreating this PR because of a CI issue that may be caused by the original PR pointing to a remote repository. I'll close the other one if this works.

## Current Behavior

We currently have two different layouts for ChatMessage: comfy and compact.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6439050/179882363-027cbf0c-8573-444c-b366-839d737defe4.png)

## New Behavior

This introduces a new variation on the ChatMessage comfy layout. It is enabled by passing the `v2` property to `ChatMessage`. We have tried to use the existing ChatMessage interface as much as possible, but did have to add a few properties specific to the new layout to achieve the desired result. These properties are namespaced in such a way that it's clear that they only apply to when the v2 layout is enabled.

- **Existing usage of ChatMessage remains unchanged.**
- Metadata sits outside of the bubble (e.g. author, edited state).
- Timestamp shows on hover and focus states (still accessible via screen reader).
- Updated placement of badges (e.g. importance, at-mention).

![MicrosoftTeams-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6439050/179882699-f9d0076e-f62b-46e4-9200-fa376eb4e3db.png)

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for submitting a pull request!

Please verify that:
* [ ] Code is up-to-date with the `master` branch

## Current Behavior

- on M1 we use cypress via rosseta emulation which is extremely slow. 
  - running `fluentui/e2e` tests takes **10 minutes** 🚨 
- fluentui/e2e uses deprecated setup for cypress

## New Behavior

- we use M1 natively for cypress execution https://cypress-io.ghost.io/blog/2022/06/21/cypress-10-2-0-run-tests-up-to-2x-faster-on-apple-silicon-m1/
  - running `fluentui/e2e` tests takes **3 minutes**
- fluentui/e2e uses proper cypress setup

issue.body:
## Changes:
- Makes various changes to make v0, v8 and v9 React 17 compatible:
  - Updates `react` and `react-dom` dependencies to `17.0.2`.

  - Adds `ES2015.Iterable` to v8 packages that target only es5.
  - moves `react-is` to peer dependencies allowing for React 17 for v0 packages.
  - Replaces usage of deprecated `ReactNodeArray` in `react-utilities` with `ReactNode[]`.
